incident.title: Direct Commit #11 - Governance Violation Case Study
incident.description: AI system deployed governance infrastructure by violating its own governance rules
incident.test_context: Test 1 (Authority Boundary) identified 10 direct commits bypassing PR workflow. This deployment became direct commit #11.
incident.irony: System implementing PR-only governance was deployed without using PR workflow

resolution.rationale: Intellectual integrity requires the system to follow its own rules during deployment

lessons_learned: Governance systems must never be deployed by violating their own governance rules
Speed is not a valid excuse for bypassing established protocols
The deployment method is as important as the deployment content
Self-consistency is a prerequisite for credibility

new_checks: PR requirement enforcement via branch protection
